Interface DieInterface


  • public interface DieInterface
    DieInterface represents a single die. Requires a constructor with no parameters. Initially the die has no value until it is rolled. A single static java.util.Random object should be the source of all randomisation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int NUMBER_OF_SIDES_ON_DIE
      note that you should not redefine this constant in the implementing class but you can use it in the implementing class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      clears the die so it has no value until it is rolled again
      int getValue() 
      boolean hasRolled() 
      void roll()
      rolls the die to give a it a value in the range 1-6
      void setSeed(long seed)
      sets the seed for the random number generator used by all dice
      void setValue(int value)
      set the face value of the die: only needed when recreating a game state

    • Field Detail

      • NUMBER_OF_SIDES_ON_DIE

        static final int NUMBER_OF_SIDES_ON_DIE
        note that you should not redefine this constant in the implementing class but you can use it in the implementing class.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • hasRolled

        boolean hasRolled()
        Returns:
        false when first constructed or cleared, then true once rolled (unless it is then cleared)

      • roll

        void roll()
        rolls the die to give a it a value in the range 1-6

      • getValue

        int getValue()
      throws NotRolledYetException
        Returns:
        the visible face of the die, a value in the range 1-6
        Throws:
        NotRolledYetException - if the die has not been rolled or has been cleared since the last roll

      • setValue

        void setValue(int value)
        set the face value of the die: only needed when recreating a game state
        Parameters:
        value - the new value of the die. If it is not in an acceptable range then afterwards hasRolled() should return false.

      • clear

        void clear()
        clears the die so it has no value until it is rolled again

      • setSeed

        void setSeed(long seed)
        sets the seed for the random number generator used by all dice
        Parameters:
        seed - the seed value to use for randomisation
